title: Fusion category
summary: In mathematics, a fusion category is a category that is rigid, semisimple, k {\displaystyle k} -linear, monoidal and has only finitely many isomorphism classes of simple objects, such that the monoidal unit is simple. If the ground field k {\displaystyle k} is algebraically closed, then the latter is equivalent to H o m ( 1 , 1 ) â‰… k {\displaystyle \mathrm {Hom} (1,1)\cong k} by Schur's lemma.
